item.title: After rocky start, Bari Weiss to cut staff, add commentators at CBS News
item.description: CBS News Editor-in-Chief Bari Weiss came in with a mandate to reshape coverage. She is set to announce plans for newsroom cuts and the hiring of many new commentators.
item.content:encoded:
60 Minutes and the CBS Evening news have sparked dissent inside the newsroom and drawn criticism from journalists outside it.'/>

CBS News Editor-in-Chief Bari Weiss came in with a mandate to reshape coverage. She is set to announce plans for newsroom cuts and the hiring of many new commentators.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)

item.title: Trump sends border czar to Minnesota. And, trial over social media addiction begins
item.description: Border czar Tom Homan heads to Minnesota to replace Greg Bovino amid the immigration crackdown backlash. And a trial starts today to decide whether social media firms knowingly harm young users.

item.title: GLP-1 drugs don't work for everyone. But personalized obesity care in the future might
item.description: As doctors learn why GLP-1s don't work for about 50% of people, they are also learning more about the complex drivers of obesity. They foresee a future of personalized obesity medicine similar to the way cancer is treated now.

item.title: In China, AI is no longer optional for some kids. It's part of the curriculum
item.description: While debate rages in the U.S. about the merits and risks of AI in schools, it's become a state-mandated part of the curriculum in China, as the authorities try to create a pool of AI-savvy professionals.
